Posts.Content: On Apr 07, 2010 5:45 PM Windymoose50 wrote: Hi Sara, I was on femara for four years and then when I got off I found out the true reason for my bone pain was Multiple Myeloma. Not surw which came first. I am a year out from femara and nothing has changed. But my pain is most likely from mm. Take care  Gayle i also am a very long timer on femara    10yrs. i like you am suffering with aches and pains, dont know where thier coming from.. after reading all the posts. i truly believe.. its femara// it all started about a year ago.. told my hubby today, im so sick and dont know why.. i now have uric acid, and taking medication for that..which also is not working..dont know how i got that..i go for blood work every few months, and see the massive change taking place..causing stop eating certain foods,to help with the issues..my body just aches all the time.. i dont smile or laugh anymore..i walk around in tears..am taking allopurinol for the acid, which does seem to be working...have no energy also/ my back is so bad, cant walk a block. so im home all the time..depressed most of the time. i also had breast cancer...both breasts.. had lump removal done.. that was 10 yrs ago.. i bought vitamin d3 for the bones. hoping this will help.i realize now.. femara which was my friend , has turned on me..and i truly thank all the wormen on this site for their help..god bless you all..  frisskie
Posts.Title: femara long term effects
